title: Signature suggested for missing trait item implementation is missing ?Sized bound

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code:

```rust
struct D;

impl rand::distributions::Distribution<()> for D {}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0046]: not all trait items implemented, missing: `sample`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:1
  |
3 | impl rand::distributions::Distribution<()> for D {} 
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ missing `sample` in implementation
  |
  = help: implement the missing item: `fn sample<R>(&self, _: &mut R) -> T where R: Rng { todo!() }`
```

Following the suggestion

```rust
use rand::Rng;

struct D;

impl rand::distributions::Distribution<()> for D {
    fn sample<R>(&self, _: &mut R) -> () where R: Rng { todo!() }
} 
```

however leads to an error about incorrectly adding a requirement

```
error[E0276]: impl has stricter requirements than trait
 --> src/lib.rs:6:5
  |
6 |     fn sample<R>(&self, _: &mut R) -> () where R: Rng { todo!() }
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ impl has extra requirement `R: Sized`
```

which might be difficult to understand as the `Sized` bound is implicit and hence it is not obvious that `?Sized` needs to be added.

Ideally, this would be part of the initial suggestion to implement the missing item as the [original signature](https://docs.rs/rand/0.8.3/src/rand/distributions/mod.rs.html#148) is indeed

```rust
fn sample<R: Rng + ?Sized>(&self, rng: &mut R) -> T;
```
